meanings.definition: Weakons (noun): Weapons that are not strong or powerful.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers carried weakons into battle.
meanings.sent2: The police confiscated illegal weakons from the criminals.
meanings.sent3: The knights tried to fight with rubber weakons, causing laughter among the enemy.
meanings.sent4: Her arguments were like using weakons against a tank.
meanings.sent5: The image of weakons made of feathers stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: Weakons (verb): To make something weaker or less effective.
meanings.sent1: He weakons his opponent by using distractions.
meanings.sent2: The harsh weather weakons the structure of the house.
meanings.sent3: The magician weakons the strength of the rope before the trick.
meanings.sent4: Her criticism seemed to weakons his confidence with every word.
meanings.sent5: The virus weakons the body's ability to fight off infections.
